Description: Fragment of strap handle of probably Attic black-glazed pottery vase, perhaps oenochoe. Wholly glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Prins de Jong suggests this is from a Campanian measuring jar. The breadth of the strap handle is unusual.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 13, N 44)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 68, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1223)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2976 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
